alert.note: Alert for La Sal and Abajo Mountains; Southeast Utah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 3:13PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern San Juan County through 345 PM MDT... At 313 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Bluff, or 14 miles northeast of Mexican Hat, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Bluff around 325 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include White Mesa. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 191 in Utah between mile markers 31 and 39. U.S. Highway 163 in Utah between mile markers 32 and 40. Utah 95 between mile markers 103 and 112. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: La Sal and Abajo Mountains; Southeast Utah
